cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:51): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: they work (in RC1)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:53): -ms-overflow-x only works in IE8 mode
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:54): unprefixed version works in quirks, IE7 and IE8 mode
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:55): hmm maybe i should test their almost standards mode some time
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:56): window.onerror is null in ie8

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:00): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, I don't think there was one in particular
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:08): do Safari, Chrome and Opera have something like chardet?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:08): if they do have it, do they deliberately not have UI for it?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:08): I wonder if Firefox could get away with having chardet always on without UI for turning it off
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:10): we have heuristics for determining the encoding, if that is what you mean
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:10): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: that's what I mean
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:11): Does anyone have any idea where ubuntu hides the python pstats module these days?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:11): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: so the heuristics are always part of the HTTP, BOM, meta, heuristics chain?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:12): without UI for changing the chain to HTTP, BOM, meta, windows-1252?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:13): discovers it is in python-profiler in multiverse despite being part of the stdlib
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:14): I'm not sure I understand encoding UI
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:14): It would be interesting to know if encoding UI is still strictly necessary
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:14): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Does anyone?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:15): guesses many browsers could reduce their encoding UI by 95%
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:15): Safari is pretty reduced, but they opted to have UI for encodings

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:17): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: It seems like pstats has an odd license which probably makes it non-free indeed (but I did not think that Ubuntu were religious about such things)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (12:18): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I think the level of religiosity depends on how generally visible and useful a package is

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (12:59): wow, about:blank has been submitted to IETF now. http://www.ietf.org/proceedings/staging/draft-holsten-about-uri-scheme-00.txt - I wasn't expecting that to be done so quickly, especially cause Joseph listed me as an editor
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:00): looks like he took what I wrote and combined it with what he had and submitted it without even letting me review the changes

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:03): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: Does "submitted to the IETF" mean anything more than "uploaded to their web servers as a temporary storage location for early drafts"?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:06): I  have no experience with the IETF submission process
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:06): Don't submitters need to promise something about rights?
84624b0535ba57fbd2aef0b147c25270 (13:09): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: what should I do about "Bad MD5 hash for http://archive.apache.org/dist/xerces/j/Xerces-J-bin.2.9.1.zip."
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:10): 84624b0535ba57fbd2aef0b147c25270: first you should check if the server gave you a 404 page or somethinga along those lines instead of a zip file
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:12): 84624b0535ba57fbd2aef0b147c25270: hmm. that's interesting
84624b0535ba57fbd2aef0b147c25270 (13:12): ETag: "cb4e73-6a17ff-43a2388b9ffc0"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:13): it has the right length
84624b0535ba57fbd2aef0b147c25270 (13:13): firefox only downloaded 4923392 bytes
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:15): Works fine for me in wget, with MD5 a0e07ede1c3bd5231fe15eae24032b2e
84624b0535ba57fbd2aef0b147c25270 (13:15): wget got the whole file, I'll try replacing build.py with localhost
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:16): You should be able to just copy the downloaded file into build/dependencies, I think
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:16): and then build.py won't try downloading it again
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:17): Uh, build/../dependencies
84624b0535ba57fbd2aef0b147c25270 (13:23): that works, thanks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:27): I also get the right md5 with curl
